name: Heirloom Tomato Salad with Crumbled Goat Cheese
author: Scott Koeneman
summary: Either way, now is when I look for ways to make our heirloom tomatoes the star of any dish I use them in. That's the case with this dish. The tomatoes were firm and sweet, with just the hint of acidity from the lemon juice, countered by the tang of onion and the creaminess of the dressing and goat cheese crumbles. Nancy and I both went back for seconds and she finished off the leftovers the next day before I could even get home!
ingredients: 6 medium heirloom tomatoes, cored and cut into wedges
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
directions: Whisk mayonnaise, buttermilk, green onions, lemon juice, garlic, and salt for dressing together in a small bowl
Chill in the refrigerator until ready to use if not serving immediately
Combine tomatoes, onion, lemon juice, salt, and pepper for salad in a bowl
Drizzle with dressing and top with crumbled goat cheese
